description: Hong Kong National Security Law context - leadership family identification explicitly defined as national security issue
importance_note: Estimated contextual importance - not from CatBoost analysis (jurisdiction-specific comparative law context)
chroma_query_template: Hong Kong National Security Law leadership family identification {case_context}

recommendations.critical: Add context that under Hong Kong National Security Law, identification of leadership family members is explicitly defined as a national security issue.
recommendations.rationale: Even if this doesn't automatically make it US national security, it's worth noting to the judge that other jurisdictions explicitly treat this as a national security matter.
recommendations.example: Under Hong Kong National Security Law, identification of leadership family members (such as Xi Mingze) is explicitly defined as a national security issue. While this does not automatically make it US national security, it provides relevant context that other jurisdictions explicitly treat this matter as a national security concern.
recommendations.insight: Providing comparative legal context can help US courts understand the sensitivity of the matter.

suggestions: Mention Hong Kong National Security Law
Explain that this is explicitly defined as national security there
Note that this provides relevant context for US court consideration
